decks.notes: The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also incorporates cards like Solitude and Goblin Bombardment for removal and extra reach. The deck aims to quickly close out the game with efficient creature attacks and burn spells, while also maintaining a strong board presence with cards like Ocelot Pride and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand, then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Goryo's Vengeance. By using instant speed reanimation spells and disruptive cards like Force of Negation, the deck looks to take control of the game early and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The use of creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler adds additional versatility and value to the deck's game plan. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

This deck aims to create a powerful combo using Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch to create infinite tokens. It includes counter spells, removal, and card draw to protect the combo pieces and ensure consistency. The deck also includes alternative win conditions and disruptive elements to control the game. With a focus on efficiency and synergy, it leverages the strength of its key combo pieces to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Phlage, Ragavan, and Scion of Draco to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes Leylines to protect its creatures and control the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial. The inclusion of Doorkeeper Thrull and Leyline Binding helps to slow down the opponent's game plan, allowing the aggro creatures to get in for more damage. Consign to Memory and Winternight Stories provide additional versatility and card advantage. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on generating value from sacrificing creatures, using them to fuel powerful combos and synergies. It aims to create a board presence with powerful creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker while also utilizing cards like Blade of the Bloodchief and Malevolent Rumble to enhance their abilities. The inclusion of cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista provide additional win conditions and flexibility in gameplay. By combining creature sacrifice effects with powerful support cards, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its synergistic combos and high-impact plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing instant speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly bring back powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Griselbrand. By combining these spells with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo. The inclusion of cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler provide additional value and disruption. The mana base is tuned to support the deck's colors and includes a variety of fetch lands to ensure consistency.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on fast and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear to deal quick damage to opponents. Slickshot Show-Off and Cori-Steel Cutter provide added utility and disruption. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration help with card selection and advantage. Lava Dart and Lightning Bolt act as removal and direct damage spells, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide combat tricks. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and efficient dual lands to ensure consistent casting of spells. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of quick and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on rapidly deploying a board full of artifact creatures while using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up quickly. The goal is to pump up these creatures using Cranial Plating and other equipment to deal massive damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The inclusion of Urza's Saga helps to find key artifacts and Thoughtcast provides card draw to keep the aggression going. Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor provide disruption and protection, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and come back from the early onslaught.

This deck aims to ramp up mana quickly and cheat big creatures into play using cards like Allosaurus Rider and Eldritch Evolution. The key strategy is to use cards like Neoform and Veil of Summer to protect your combo pieces and ensure they can successfully resolve. Once you have enough mana, you can drop powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield and overwhelm your opponent with their size and abilities. Consign to Memory and Pact of Negation also help control the game and protect your combo pieces when needed.

The deck revolves around quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cheat out big threats like Primeval Titan. The goal is to assemble the Amulet Titan combo, which allows for explosive plays and combos with cards like Urza's Saga and Malevolent Rumble. The deck utilizes lands like Crumbling Vestige and Urza's Cave to ensure consistent mana production, while including utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures for protection. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with disruption spells like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory, while also utilizing creatures with powerful abilities like Sanctifier en-Vec and Starfield Shepherd. The deck aims to control the board through removal and disruption, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Orchid Phantom and Solitude. It also has graveyard hate with Rest in Peace to shut down graveyard-centric strategies. Overall, the deck plays a proactive game plan that aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Tune the Narrative, the deck aims to stall the opponent and control the board until it can win with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer. The deck also includes versatile removal like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantage and powerful finishers.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of creatures and spells to quickly generate enough mana, then use cards like Goblin Charbelcher to deal direct damage to your opponent. Disrupting Shoal and other counterspells provide protection while Jwari Disruption and Sink into Stupor help control the board. Whir of Invention can help you search for key combo pieces, while cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide additional value. Overall, the deck aims to create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent without any traditional lands.

This deck aims to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards with Narset and Teferi. It utilizes a variety of spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. Additionally, the deck includes a companion creature to provide additional value and flexibility. The land base is carefully constructed to support the control strategy and ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outlast opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to aggressively attack with creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear while using efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to remove any threats or finish off the opponent. Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and help smooth out draws. The deck aims to win the game quickly by maintaining pressure on the opponent and staying ahead in tempo.
